author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Commissioner of Madurai Corporation C. Kathiravan announced on Monday that drinking water distribution in some parts of the city would be suspended for three days from January 21 to 23.

Following major leaks and damages spotted on the pipeline at Kullapuram near Vengayan Odai, which sourced water from the Vaigai dam, engineers proposed to suspend water distribution to enable them to carry out repair works. Hence, wards from 5 to 9, 27, 33 to 47 comprising Aruldosspuram, Thathaneri, Sellur, Meenakshipuram, Kulamangalam Road, Goripalayam, Race Course Colony, DRO Colony, P and T Nagar, B.B. Kulam, Narimedu, Pudur, Anna Nagar, K.K. Nagar, Madhichiyam and Karumbalai and surrounding parts would not get water supply.

Similarly, wards from 19, 28, 63, 64, 77, 88 to 93 consisting of HMS Colony, Virattipathu, Ponmeni, Sammatipuram, Sundararajapuram, Jaihindpuram, TVS Nagar, Muthupatti, Alagappan Nagar, Keerathurai, Villapuram and surrounding areas will not have normal distribution for the three days.

Authorities had been taking steps to supply water through tankers to places where it was required, Mr. Kathiravan said in a press release.
title: Water supply to be suspended for three days
